content.question: A certain store has 3,000 employees working at its main location in a city and 100 employees working at a smaller location outside the city. The store manager will select a sample of 50 employees from all the employees to ask their opinions about extending store hours during the holidays. What is the advantage of selecting a stratified random sample, with location as strata, instead of a simple random sample?

choices.label: The stratified sample assures the most random selection from among all selection methods.
The stratified sample assures that the opinions of employees from both locations will be represented.
The stratified sample will be less expensive to implement than a simple random sample and will save money over time.
The stratified sample assures employees that store hours will not be extended until their opinions are recorded.
There is no real advantage to stratifying because a simple random sample is always the best.

content.answer: The stratified sample assures that the opinions of employees from both locations will be represented.
